project.name: Java
project.description: The Java Project handles all Gentoo-related Java things.

longdescription.p: The Java herd maintains most packages related to Java development in the Portage tree, which at the present time of writing encompass over 350 different packages.

Highlights include the Apache Java Projects, JDK/JREs from Blackdown, Sun, IBM, Compaq, BEA, and of course Kaffe. We also package some alternative languages for the JVM, such as Groovy, Scala, JRuby, and Jython. We package IDEs such as Eclipse, and NetBeans. And of course, there is a wide variety of different and popular Java libraries.

body.p: Due to severe attrition this past year, we now just barely have enough manpower to maintain our 350+ packages. This leaves hardly any leftover time and energy to extend our offering into new areas, such as natively compiled Java packages using gcj, extensively packaging popular Eclipse plugins, or creation of a stable and complete J2EE development platform.
If you have any interest in helping, consider these options:

ul.li: Joining our gentoo-java mailing list and asking/answering questions.
Spreading the word about Gentoo as a Java development platform.
